scenario_text.value:
Oh, Takuma! The walls in here have lots of
drawings too!

Yeah, they do. And there’s another huge mural
covering the whole wall...

Incredible! This mural is like nothing else
I’ve ever seen!

It appears to be portraying the link between
humans and Kemonogami.

They’re bound together by what looks like
a string.

Might this be meant to explain that humans
and Kemonogami were once much closer?

No, if that were all, surely the other murals
would suffice.

But then what is this expressing? The center
of the body...is that meant to be the heart?
Or perhaps the soul?
“Soul”? What do you mean?

It’s an even more fundamental part of one’s
being than the heart, the essence of oneself.

Humans have referred to this concept as the
soul since ancient times.

Takuma, Agumon, surely you two have also felt
a connection on that level.

One that goes beyond trust or affection, as
if you were inextricably linked together.

Oh, yeah! I know that feeling! It’s how
I know Takuma is my fated child!
Yes, of course. I’ve...felt that way myself.

We humans and certain Kemonogami are each
bound to a specific individual.

Someone with whom they feel they belong, as
if they were two halves of the same soul.
So...you’re like the other half of my soul?

Heheh, it’s actually a little embarrassing to
talk about.
Dracumon must have been like that for Kaito.

I wonder what it feels like for him to have
half his soul fused with Piemon.

Hey, don’t get so down, Aoi. Remember, it’s
because Kaito’s on the verge...

...of making a huge mistake that we gotta
remind him of what’s right.

I couldn’t agree more. Half of Voltobautamon
is Dracumon.

Which means if we can change Kaito’s mind, we
can stop him from destroying the world.

This passage leads to the lowest level, where
Miyuki and the Master are waiting.
I hope you’re all ready for this.

You bet we are! Let’s go save Kaito and
Miyuki!

It all comes down to this! We’ve got to find
a way to reach Kaito and Miyuki.

We’re both prepared to fight as well. However
hard things get, we’ll triumph in the end.

We have to. I’ve seen enough suffering. We
don’t need more.

Let’s all make it out of this together. Every
last one of us!

I’m sure we can find a way for this to end
well. Let’s trust in that as we move forward!
Okay, everyone. Follow me.
